articles/setup.html.title: Setup | ReGen SDK
articles/setup.html.keywords: Setup We need to initialize the sdk with the endpoint. ReGenClient.Initialize("web api endpoint"); The client can then be accessed by it's Instance member; var client = ReGenClient.Instance; The api can be accessed from it's services; var recipes = client.Recipes; View the API reference for more details. AuthenticationService FavoriteService RatingService RecipeService ReviewService SearchService

System.String password the password of the user. Returns System.Threading.Tasks.Task < Firebase.Auth.FirebaseUser > A Task that if succesfully completes, results in the Firebase.Auth.FirebaseUser. SignInUserWithFacebook(String) Signs in a user with a Facebook access token. If their is a user already logged in, this will link the Facebook account with the currently logged in user. If the User does not have an account, an account is automatically created for them. This method does sign in the user if successful. Declaration [NotNull] public abstract Task<FirebaseUser> SignInUserWithFacebook([NotNull] string accessToken) Parameters System.String accessToken The accessToken returned from Facebook Authentication. Returns System.Threading.Tasks.Task < Firebase.Auth.FirebaseUser > A Task that if succesfully completes, results in the Firebase.Auth.FirebaseUser. SignOut() Signs out the currently logged in user by clearing all authentication data. This method never fails and succeeds immediately. Declaration public abstract void SignOut()

articles/tasks.html.title: Callbacks | ReGen SDK
articles/tasks.html.keywords: Callbacks This SDK includes extension methods on tasks for callbacks. TaskCallbackExtensions These callbacks are always called on the main thread and can be used as such ReGenClient.Instance.Recipes.Get("recipeId").Success(async recipe => { var name = recipe.Name; var reviews = await recipe.Reviews(); // etc... }); or it can be used async await style with Run(Func<Task>) using static ReGenSDK.Tasks.MainThreadTask; public async Task DoOperation(Recipe recipe) { return Run(async () => { // code in here is executed on the main thread // for example var rating = await client.Reviews.Get(recipe.Key); await client.Reviews.Update(recipe.Key, 1); }); }
